feed.title: CDC's Facebook Wall
feed.subtitle: An RSS feed of posts to the CDC Facebook site.

entry.title: Good communication is essential to control #Ebola. According to CDC #DiseaseDete...
entry.summary: Good communication is essential to control #Ebola. According to CDC #DiseaseDetective Rebecca, the most important and difficult part of her job in W. Africa will be figuring out how to communicate the right health information, in the right way, to the affected communities. “I’m excited about talking to community health workers to learn what is going on. And as time goes on, I hope to see our messages getting out to the people. It will be an evolving process.” Read her story: http://go.usa.gov/EZkz

entry.title: New #Ebola ward opens today in Nigeria. Replaces old ward, will give safer patie...
entry.summary: New #Ebola ward opens today in Nigeria. Replaces old ward, will give safer patient care and isolation.

What Comes After Ebola
time.com
The headquarters of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in Atlanta is buzzing because of a disease that has never killed a single person on U.S. soil. Here’s why

entry.title: Capture your commitment to #VetoViolence against women! Post a photo and six-wor...
entry.summary: Capture your commitment to #VetoViolence against women! Post a photo and six-word story about healthy and safe relationships to Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram. Please use hashtag #VetoViolence! Learn more. http://on.fb.me/1tCGg5K

entry.title: Rebecca is a CDC #DiseaseDetective and the mother of two young boys. She is depl...
entry.summary: Rebecca is a CDC #DiseaseDetective and the mother of two young boys. She is deploying this week to West Africa in support of the ongoing Ebola outbreak. A health communicator who will be working in the field to improve health messaging at the community level, Rebecca is determined to make these 30 days count. “It is so hard to leave them,” Rebecca said of her children, just days before deploying for her tour of duty in West Africa. “But I tell them I’m going to help other moms and dads with little girls and boys.” Read her story: http://go.usa.gov/EZkz.

entry.title: Watch the #CDCGrandRounds live webcast on Tuesday, August 19, at 1pm ET and join...
entry.summary: Watch the #CDCGrandRounds live webcast on Tuesday, August 19, at 1pm ET and join the discussion on the public health implications of #infertility. Infertility affects about 6% of married women 15–44 years of age and an additional 12% suffer from impaired ability to get pregnant or carry a pregnancy to a live birth. 9% of U.S. men are also affected by male-related infertility. http://go.usa.gov/EZT3

entry.title: Today, CDC released a series of updates and actions taken showing its progress i...
entry.summary: Today, CDC released a series of updates and actions taken showing its progress in laboratory safety following recent anthrax and H5N1 flu lab incidents. CDC will continue to take all necessary steps to maintain safety and advance CDC’s critical laboratory science work, so that CDC labs are as safe as they are scientifically rigorous. Read today’s statement: http://go.usa.gov/EWeV.

entry.title: Are you a parent or teacher? Do you make fruit & veggies easy for kids to choose...
entry.summary:
Are you a parent or teacher? Do you make fruit & veggies easy for kids to choose? Do you eat them with your kids? Doing one or both may increase the chances kids will eat them too! Get more tips here: http://go.usa.gov/EWcx. #VitalSigns


Vital Signs Graphics

entry.title: Early detection of #Ebola is important for providing appropriate supportive care...
entry.summary: Early detection of #Ebola is important for providing appropriate supportive care & preventing the spread of infection. Standard hospital treatments include giving fluids and electrolytes, keeping oxygen levels and blood pressure stable, and treating any complicating infections. Supportive care may improve a patient’s chances of survival. Experimental treatments are still in early stages of testing & are in very limited supply. We know how to stop Ebola’s spread with basic public health methods: finding Ebola cases, isolating and caring for patients, and tracing contacts to stop the chains of transmission.

entry.title: You've met several CDC #DiseaseDetectives fighting #Ebola in West Africa. If you...
entry.summary: You've met several CDC #DiseaseDetectives fighting #Ebola in West Africa. If you could ask them one question about their work, what would it be?

CDC Steps Up Response to Ebola Outbreak in West Africa
wabe.org
The Atlanta-based Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has stepped up its timetable for getting workers to West Africa to help fight the Ebola

entry.title: The amount of veggies kids ate from 2003-2010 did not change, and was too low. F...
entry.summary:
The amount of veggies kids ate from 2003-2010 did not change, and was too low. Find out more: http://go.usa.gov/EYuP. #VitalSigns


Vital Signs Graphics

entry.title: Like all CDC staff, #DiseaseDetective Greg is as aware of the risks. “Being safe...
entry.summary: Like all CDC staff, #DiseaseDetective Greg is as aware of the risks. “Being safe and careful are guiding principles of our mission to stop the spread of Ebola. My short-term goal is to help do the basics of public health epidemiology – preventing the spread through contact tracing – with the long- term goal of ending the outbreak. It will happen, but only through painstaking hard work.” Read his story: http://go.usa.gov/EqKG.

entry.title: CDC’s #Ebola effort is not all overseas. A disease threat anywhere in the world...
entry.summary: CDC’s #Ebola effort is not all overseas. A disease threat anywhere in the world is a threat everywhere in the world, and CDC is preparing for any possibility, including that a traveler might become ill with Ebola while in the United States. Although Ebola poses very little or no risk to the U.S. community at large, CDC and healthcare providers in the United States need to be prepared. Read what CDC is doing here in the US: http://go.usa.gov/ExYd

entry.title: CDC now has more than 50 disease detectives and other highly trained experts bat...
entry.summary: CDC now has more than 50 disease detectives and other highly trained experts battling #Ebola on the ground in West Africa – successfully deploying in less than 2 weeks the surge of help we promised within 30 days. Here in the U.S., more than 350 CDC staff are working 24/7 to support the response. Read about CDC’s efforts to stop the outbreak: http://go.usa.gov/ExCh.

entry.title: It’s time for #publichealth action on #infertility. The next CDC Public Health G...
entry.summary: It’s time for #publichealth action on #infertility. The next CDC Public Health Grand Rounds will discuss strategies associated with the detection, prevention, and management of infertility. It will also address clinical approaches to improving the safety and efficacy of infertility treatments in an effort to promote healthy pregnancy outcomes. Join us Tuesday, August 19 at 1pm ET for the live webcast. Follow @CDCgov on Twitter and participate in the event using the hashtag #CDCGrandrounds. http://go.usa.gov/EcBA

Inside the Ebola outbreak with the CDC
edition.cnn.com
Nine CDC team members are in Lagos, Nigeria, to fight the Ebola outbreak. Learn how they're trying to stop the Ebola virus from spreading.

entry.title: Madame Djéné CONDE, The First Lady of the Republic of Guinea, visited CDC in Atl...
entry.summary: Madame Djéné CONDE, The First Lady of the Republic of Guinea, visited CDC in Atlanta, Georgia, on August 12, 2014. Madame Conde toured the Emergency Operations Center and met with Dr. Tom Frieden and other leaders on CDC’s Ebola efforts. She also taped a public safety announcement in the CDC studios to be used for Ebola prevention efforts in her home country of Guinea.

entry.title: Greg is no stranger to risk. Originally trained as a Navy diver, he is now a CDC...
entry.summary: Greg is no stranger to risk. Originally trained as a Navy diver, he is now a CDC #DiseaseDetective and officer in the US Public Health Service. He has worked on several potentially dangerous diseases so when the call came to be deployed to West Africa for the #Ebola outbreak, he wasn’t concerned. In fact, he readily volunteered. He is going to help with the vital and enormous task of contact tracing for the Ebola outbreak. Read his story: http://go.usa.gov/EqKG.

entry.title: 9 in 10 kids, 2 to 18 years old, don’t eat enough vegetables. And, many of the...
entry.summary:
9 in 10 kids, 2 to 18 years old, don’t eat enough vegetables. And, many of the veggies they do eat are fried, white potatoes. The vegetables kids eat should be colorful and made in healthy ways. Get tips here: http://go.usa.gov/PSj9. #VitalSigns


Vital Signs Graphics

entry.title: Meredith is a doctor, but her job as CDC #DiseaseDetective was to help find wher...
entry.summary: Meredith is a doctor, but her job as CDC #DiseaseDetective was to help find where to send health workers to look for people sick with #Ebola and trace people exposed to them. At one hospital, she met a man waiting for medical care who died the next day from Ebola. “As a physician, when you see someone who is sick you inherently want to touch that person – to reassure him as much as to examine him. It is just what you do as a doctor. Not being able to touch someone who was suffering was strange and unpleasant for me, even though it was necessary.” Read her story: http://1.usa.gov/1uKLUk1.

What You Bring When You're Going Into an Ebola Outbreak
time.com
Meet the CDC officers going into West Africa to fight Ebola

entry.title: Meredith, a CDC Disease Detective and experienced international traveler, comple...
entry.summary: Meredith, a CDC Disease Detective and experienced international traveler, completed two month-long postings to West Africa. In early May, when her first posting came to an end, the feeling on the ground was the Ebola outbreak was winding down. It’s now clear that this was a temporary lull before the outbreak resumed with a vengeance. When cases flared up again, Meredith returned in July. http://1.usa.gov/1uKLUk1

entry.title: Kids are eating more fruit but not more veggies. The amount they’re eating of bo...
entry.summary:
Kids are eating more fruit but not more veggies. The amount they’re eating of both is too low. With 60 million US kids in childcare & schools, these places can play a role in increasing fruit & veggie intake. Find out more: http://go.usa.gov/PANH. #VitalSigns


Vital Signs Graphics

entry.title: Right now, #Ebola is a major risk in West Africa. CDC Director, Dr. Tom Frieden...
entry.summary:
Right now, #Ebola is a major risk in West Africa. CDC Director, Dr. Tom Frieden explains in new Fox News opinion piece why there’s not significant risk in the United States, and what we’re doing to stop the outbreak where it starts in W. Africa. fxn.ws/1rckv8s


The truth about Ebola, US risks and how to stop it
www.foxnews.com
There are really two things that have, I am afraid, been confusing in the publicity on Ebola in the past week.
